result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darien Shavar Ballard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darien Shavar Ballard appeared by video.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Darien Shavar Ballard.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 12CF2608. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Schaefer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darien Shavar Ballard in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Rosenberg unavailable due to a scheduling conflict. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 7/08/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Darien Shavar Ballard in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Franke, Branch 25.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.   Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Darien Shavar Ballard not in court.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-24-2022 @1p
